## Getting Started

### Measures

[Fire Experiment](fire.html) example demonstrates
how to:

<aside>
[![Fire](img/pages-fireView-1.png)](fire.html)
</aside>

* define and run experiments, export view images,
* define temporal measures (step measures),
* define final measures (simulation run measures),
* aggregate temporal measures over time.

---

[Segregation](segregation.html) example shows how to obtain data from 
individual NetLogo agents:

<aside>
[![](img/pages-segregPlot-1.png)](segregation.html)
</aside>

* define and run experiment with "agents-after" measure,
* visualize position of agents from different groups.

---

[Network](network.html) example collects values from
 turtles and their links:

<aside>
[![](img/pages-agentsGraphPlot-1.png)](network.html)
</aside>

* define experiment to get data about network structure (turtles, links),
* recreate network as igraph object,
* map turtle variables to igraph vertices,
* aggregate network measures (_example in construction_).

---

[Traffic](traffic.html) example collects values from 
individual turtles per each time step:

<aside>
[![](img/pages-trafficPlot-1.png)](traffic.html)
</aside>

* definition of "agents step" measure,
* visualizing several agents' position and speed in time.


---

[DLA](dla.html) (diffusion-limited aggregation) example demonstrates 
how to read position and other variables from NetLogo patches 
(after simulation run).

<aside>
[![](img/pages-dlaPlot-1.png)](dla.html)
</aside>

* definition of "patches_after"" measure,
* visualizing patches.

---

### Parameter Sets
The following examples show how to define parameter value sets.
See also examples in [Sensitivity Analysis](#Sensitivity Analysis) for 
other parameter space exploring methods.

<aside>
[![Ants](img/pages-antsPlotViews-1.png)](ants.html)
</aside>

[Ants](ants.html) example demonstrates experiment 
definition with full factorial design and mapping parameters 
to NetLogo variables.


* Define parameter value sets as a combination from a list of values
* Map parameter names to NetLogo variables
* Visualize several temporal measures with 2D parameter space 

---

[Fur Patterns](fur.html) demonstrates 
explicit definition of parameter value sets 
with transformed parameter space. 

<aside>
[![](img/pages-furShowPatches-1.png)](fur.html)
</aside>

* Create parameter values
* Transform values to NetLogo model variables
* Define experiment with a data frame of parameter sets 

---

[Flocking Example](flocking.html) demonstrates temporal measure definition
and visualization of temporal measures in the parameter space:

<aside>
[![](img/pages-flockPlotGrid-1.png)](flocking.html)
</aside>

* temporal measure with custom step definition (one step includes several _ticks_ in NetLogo)
* simulation repetitions of stochastic model with predefined random seeds

It is the first in a series of parameter space exploration of the Flocking model

---

[Categorical Criteria](flocking_categorical.html) example 
explores parameter space with full factorial design
and categorical criteria:

<aside>
[![](img/pages-pFlockCatPlot-1.png)](flocking_categorical.html)
</aside>

* Parameter sets are defined as all combination of values,
* temporal measures are aggregated in time and used to define a categorical criteria,
* parameter space is visualized with categorical criteria.

---

[Hyper Latin Cube Sampling](flocking_sampling.html) examples
demontrate how to explore parameter space with categorical 
criteria and sampling methods.

<aside>
  [![](img/pages-flockSampPlot-1.png)](flocking_sampling.html)
</aside>

<a name="Sensitivity Analysis"> 
</a>

* Explore parameter space with categorical criteria (how to define categorical
measures from temporal measures)
* Full factor design and LHC random sampling


## Sensitivity Analysis

Example [Random sampling](flocking_sens_lhs.html) explores 5-dimensional 
parameter space of NetLogo Flocking model
with random sampling and scatter plots.

<aside>
[![](img/pages-flockSensLhsPlot1-1.png)](flocking_sens_lhs.html)

[![](img/pages-flockFastPlot-1.png)](flocking_fast.html)

</aside>

[One-at-a-time](flocking_sens_oat.html) example demonstrates
sensitivity analysis with OAT method.


Example [FAST](flocking_fast.html) demonstrates
sensitivity analysis with Fourier Amplitude Sensitivity Test (FAST).

[![](img/pages-flockFastPairs-1.png)](flocking_fast.html)

## Optimization
Parameter fitting with best-fit criterion 
and optimization methods.

* [Best-fit Criterion](flocking_bestfit.html) shows how to define 
  single criterion evaluation expression 
  and evaluate parameter space with factorial design.
<aside>
[<img src = "img/pages-flockBestFitPlot1-1.png"/>](flocking_bestfit.html)
[<img src = "img/pages-flockSampPlot1-1.png"/>](flocking_random.html)
[<img src = "img/pages-pFlockNMPlot2-1.png"/>](flocking_nm.html)

</aside>


* [Random Search](flocking_random_search.html) demonstrate searching for optimal parameters
  using random search.

* [L-BFGS-B Optimization](flocking_bfgs.html) shows how to use
  standard optimization functions.

* [Nelder-Mead Optimization](flocking_nm.html) shows how to use
  optimization functions from other R packages.

* [Simulated Annealing](flocking_sa.html) demonstrates optimization
  with simulated annealing.

* [Genetic Algorithm](flocking_ga.html) demonstrates optimization
  with genetic algorithm.
